p.s: In the past few weeks I read the book The Hate U Give with my English class and got very intrestedinterested about the topic racism in the US, which is the main topic in the novel.
So yesterday I came across a very suprisingly article about the racism in the US, and I would love to herhear your opinion about it and if you can relate to some of those facts.
The article is named Black in the US: The racism is still present and was published by a famous German news provider: Zeit Online.
The article starts ofoff with the fact that the 18 year old African-American Michael Brown got shot by a cop two weeks ago.
The author Alexandra Endres writes that the chances that something like stop-and-frisk happendshappens, is much higher for African-Americans thenthan for whites.
This statistic generally shows that whites have less handicaps than African-Americans, like white-Americans mostly have a better social and economic position.
In addition I want to let you know that the article says, that African-Americans usually doesn'tdon't finishesfinish school, so they didn't get a chance to make a difference in their lifeslives.
But if they get their qualifications, it doesn't mean they are going to have the same chances in the future than whites.
All in all I want to know if the article is right about this topic and if you can relate to some of those given facts or not.
I'm excited to hear from you again.
